sources.snippet_or_excerpt: Date: Thu, Dec 18, 2025 | 04:50 AM GMT The broader cryptocurrency market has remained under pressure in recent weeks, struggling to regain...
Market reports linked the selloff to renewed fears that the BoJ will tighten monetary policy at its meeting this week, threatening the yen...
Bitcoin slid to the $85000 level on December 15, extending its recent decline as global macro risks, leverage unwinding, and thin liquidity...
Crypto may face major volatility as the US job market weakens, pushing the Fed toward a pivotal December policy shift.
Bitcoin prices pushed lower on Thursday, November 20, extending recent losses as macro variables fueled weakness in the markets.

hypothesis_content.title: Liquidation Cascade Reversal Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: A sharp, high-volume price drop (>8% in <2 hours for BTC) triggered by a cascade of long liquidations (>$300M in 24h) will be followed by an exaggerated but transient rebound. This 'dead cat bounce' will fail to reclaim a key technical level (prior 4H support turned resistance) and present a high-probability short entry.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Liquidation cascades are driven by forced selling, not fundamental re-assessment. The violent move often exhausts immediate sellers. The subsequent rebound is fueled by opportunistic dip-buying and short covering, but the underlying weak structure and damaged sentiment remain, leading to a failure at a logical technical level before a retest of lows.
entry_conditions: BTC drops >8% within 2 hours on volume >150% of 20-day average
Price rebounds to test a prior 4-hour support level (now resistance) within 12 hours of the low
1-hour candle shows rejection at this level (upper wick > body) with declining volume on the approach

exit_conditions.take_profit: Move down to within 1% of the initial cascade low
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 1-hour close >3% above the identified resistance level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: In >55% of cases, the rebound after such a liquidation cascade continues beyond the key resistance level and sustains, indicating a true V-shaped recovery rather than a fade opportunity.
